message.content:
We only need to “accumulate” the depreciation entries. In this data there is no opening balance of accumulated depreciation (that is, at the beginning the book‐balance is zero). Then, the only two depreciation transactions recorded are:

• On 2024‑01‑01 (transaction ID “Depreciation20240101001”) for 45,740.94  
• On 2024‑02‑01 (transaction ID “Depreciation20240201002”) for 71,799.68  

The accumulated depreciation at period start is therefore 0.00; adding the depreciation expense recorded during the period we get an ending balance of

  0.00 + 45,740.94 + 71,799.68 = 117,540.62

Thus the final answer is:

{
  "Accumulated Depreciation Initial Value": "0.00",
  "Accumulated Depreciation End Value": "117540.62"
}
